note: Depending on the country and year, the data relates to income (measured after taxes and benefits) or to consumption, [per capita](#dod:per-capita). Following an update, World Bank PIP now uses 2021 [international-$](#dod:int_dollar_abbreviation) for its poverty and inequality data [available here](https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/daily-mean-income).
title: Mean income or consumption per day: 2011 vs. 2017 international-$
subtitle: This data is adjusted for inflation and differences in living costs between countries.
